SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Provide a Consistent Experience for Effective Accounts

If your storefront supports effective accounts, you can ensure that a selected effective account propagates throughout your Visualforce storefront or Experience Builder site.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: In previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, the B2B Commerce Header component for an Experience Builder site didn't show the Effective Account Selector widget at all.

This release adds the Effective Account Selector to the B2B Commerce Header component, which provides parity with the standard header component for a Visualforce storefront page.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, the new B2B Commerce Header component includes the Effective Account Selector automatically when your storefront enables effective accounts.

A new browser cookie, LSKey[c]effacc, is set with the effective account's ID when a buyer selects an effective account and browses on an Experience Builder site. When the buyer navigates to a Visualforce storefront page, the apex__effacc cookie—used in previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce—continues to specify the same effective account ID. Both cookies are created and set simultaneously, no matter which context—Visualforce page or Experience Builder site—selects the effective account first.

title: Consistent Effective Account Experience
